action_description:
TODOs to make this action work:

1. Create a VirusTotal account (https://www.virustotal.com/) and get your API key (expand your profile in the top right corner and click on "APIKey")

2. In Admyral, go to Settings and store the API key with the following name: virus_total_api_key

The workflow expects the data to be triggered as a POST request with the following HTTP request body:

{
    "hash": "<file-hash-here>"
}

Example cURL:

curl -d '{"hash": "8d3f68b16f0710f858d8c1d2c699260e6f43161a5510abb0e7ba567bd72c965b"}' \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" "<webhook-url-here>"
VirusTotal returns HTTP status 200 if the hash is found.
We use GPT-4 to summarize the result from VirusTotal as a report.

action_definition.prompt:
As a security analyst, create a high-level and short summary of the subsequent findings regarding a file hash.

Here are the findings for the file hash:

<<search_hash_in_virustotal.body>>

action_description:
TODOs to make this action work:

- put your email below into recipients

action_definition.body:
Hi there!

Here is the report for the file hash "<<webhook.body.hash>>":

<<summarize_virustotal_findings.output>>
action_definition.subject: File Hash Analysis for <<webhook.body.hash>>

action_description: Retrieve the feed from Threatpost

Send the summarized news via email

TODO: Add recipient for the workflow to work
Use GPT4 to summarize the results from the HTTP action (the Threatpost feed)

action_definition.prompt:
Extract and summarize articles from the response containing multiple news items about cybersecurity. Focus on key details like event descriptions, the impact on affected entities, and relevant multimedia content. The summary should be concise and suitable for an email newsletter format. Only answer with the extraction/summary. Do not explain how you do it!

Do it for the following feed:
<<retrieve_threatpost_feed.body>>

action_description: We use GPT-4 to summarize the result from YARAify as a report.

action_definition.prompt:
As a security analyst, create a high-level and short summary of the subsequent findings regarding a file hash.

Here are the findings for the file hash:

<<search_hash_in_yaraify.body>>

action_description:
Query the API for a SHA256 hash

YARAify Documentation:
https://yaraify.abuse.ch/api/#query-filehash

TODOs to make this action work:

- put your email below into recipients

action_definition.body:
Hi there!

The file hash <<webhook.body.hash>> couldn't be found in YARAify.
action_definition.subject: File Hash <<webhook.body.hash>> not found

action_description: YARAify returns HTTP status 200 if the hash is found.

The workflow expects the data to be triggered as a POST request with the following HTTP request body:

{
    "hash": "<file-hash-here>"
}

Example cURL:

curl -d '{"hash": "8d3f68b16f0710f858d8c1d2c699260e6f43161a5510abb0e7ba567bd72c965b"}' \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" "<webhook-url-here>"

The workflow expects the data to be triggered as a POST request with the following HTTP request body:

{
    "url": "<url-here>"
}

Example cURL:

curl -d '{"url": "www.google.com"}' \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" "<webhook-url-here>"

The workflow expects the data to be triggered as a POST request with the following HTTP request body:

{
    "ip": "<ip-here>"
}

Example cURL:

curl -d '{"ip": "118.25.6.39"}' \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" "<webhook-url-here>"
TODO to make this action work:\n\nSet a recipient who should receive the report

action_definition.body:
Here is your reported case: 

Case ID: <<retrieve_case_from_phish_report.body.id>>

Pending Actions: 
Description:<<retrieve_case_from_phish_report.body[0].pending_actions[0].description>>

Report URI: <<retrieve_case_from_phish_report.body[0].pending_actions[0].report_uri>>

Role:<<retrieve_case_from_phish_report.body.pending_actions[0].params.role>>
action_definition.subject: Phish Report Case

action_name: Look up IP address in AbuseIPDB
action_description:
TODOs to make this action work:

1. Navigate to https://www.abuseipdb.com/ and click "Sign up" to create a new account. Existing AbuseIPDB users can click "Login"

2. Click "API" and then "Create Key" in the middle panel

3. Give the key a name and then copy the key

4. In Admyral, store the key in Admyral Credential (within your account settings) and name it abuseipdb_api_key.

action_name: Look up IP address in VirusTotal
action_description:
TODOs to make this action work:

1. Create a VirusTotal account (https://www.virustotal.com/) and get your API key (expand your profile in the top right corner and click on "APIKey")

2. In Admyral, go to Settings and store the API key with the following name: virus_total_api_key
We use GPT-4 to summarize the result as a report.

action_definition.prompt:
As a security analyst, create a high-level and short summary of the subsequent findings regarding an IP.

Here are the findings for the IP from AbuseIPDB:
<<look_up_ip_address_in_abuseipdb.body>>

Here are the findings for the IP from VirusTotal:
<<look_up_ip_address_in_virustotal.body>>

Here are the findings for the IP from GreyNoise:
<<look_up_ip_address_in_greynoise.body>>

Here are the findings for the IP from PulseDive:
<<look_up_ip_address_in_pulsedive.body>>

action_name: Look up IP address in GreyNoise
action_description:
TODOs to make this action work:

1. Create a GreyNoise account (https://viz.greynoise.io/) and get your API key (expand your profile in the top right corner and click on "APIKey")

2. In Admyral, go to Settings and store the API key with the following name: greynoise_api_key

NOTE: 
In case you want to use the enterprise instead of the community version, change the URL to: 
https://api.greynoise.io/v2/noise/context/<<webhook.body.ip>>
